snippet: Charter’s $10.4 billion bid for Bright House is the latest big merger announced as corporations in sectors including technology, media and health care seek to combine.
abstract: Charter Communications announces $10.4 billion merger with Bright House Networks, deal that would create second-largest cable operator in country behind Comcast; announcement falls in with trend of high-level consolidation in industries like technology, media and health care; executives have said deal will not proceed should regulators block earlier proposed merger between Comcast and Time Warner Cable.

byline.original: By EMILY STEEL and DAVID GELLES

lead_paragraph: Charter’s $10.4 billion bid for Bright House is the latest big merger announced as corporations in sectors including technology, media and health care seek to combine.

headline.main: Charter Communications’ Bid for Cable Rival Bright House Networks Among Last Merger Wave
headline.print_headline: Charter Bids $10.4 Billion to Acquire Cable Rival
